ISSUE.TITLE: Documentation - cmd from podman_tutorial.md returns error on raspberry pi4
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description Running this command: ```podman run --name basic_httpd -dt -p 8080:8080/tcp -e HTTPD_VAR_RUN=/run/httpd -e HTTPD_MAIN_CONF_D_PATH=/etc/httpd/conf.d \ -e HTTPD_MAIN_CONF_PATH=/etc/httpd/conf \ -e HTTPD_CONTAINER_SCRIPTS_PATH=/usr/share/container-scripts/httpd/ \ registry.fedoraproject.org/f29/httpd /usr/bin/run-httpd ``` from the [tutorial](https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/main/docs/tutorials/podman_tutorial.md) returns this output: ```no image found in manifest list for architecture arm64, variant "v8", OS linux``` When run from rabsian on a raspberry pi4. I am trying to learn podman - one hour a day - and I guess this is trivial. But I haven't been able to figure it out. I guess I could try to pull from docker hub instead of fedoraproject? Or maybe specify the platform? ### Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Install rasbian via noobs 2. install podman via apt-get 3. try to invoke the `podman run`command above. ### Describe the results you received Error describing that the image does not match the architecture ### Describe the results you expected a working pod ### podman info output ```yaml podman 3.0.1 PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)" ``` ### Podman in a container No ### Privileged Or Rootless None ### Upstream Latest Release Yes ### Additional environment details Additional environment details ### Additional information Additional information like issue happens only occasionally or issue happens with a particular architecture or on a particular setting

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #20924 from Luap99/labeler [CI:DOCS] fix broken labeler.yml config

COMMIT.MESSAGE: [CI:DOCS]use nginx in podman tutorial the podman tutorial refers to an old httpd image based on Fedora 29. It is x86_64 only so Apple Silicon Macs and RPI's cannot follow the tutorial. Switch to nginx Fixes: #20916 [NO NEW TESTS NEEDED] Signed-off-by: Brent Baude <bbaude@redhat.com>
